name: General Trivial Stuff Quiz | Mixed 10 Questions | 10 Questions

questions.text: What were the first words spoken by Frosty the Snowman according to the song of the same name?
questions.explanation:
Happy Birthday.

	The hat was blown away in the wind from the evil magician who tried in vain to get it back. The song "Frosty the Snowman" was sung by Jimmy Durante.

questions.text: What was Jimmy's last name in the movie "Quadrophenia"?
questions.explanation:
Cooper.

	The movie "Quadrophenia" was adapted from the Who's album of the same name.  Actor Phil Daniels starred as the title character Jimmy Cooper.

questions.text: How many passengers were aboard the Mayflower?
questions.explanation:
102.

	No girls were aboard the Mayflower but there were 3 pregnant women aboard when it first set sail. All 3 gave birth to boys. Sadly, one was a stillborn.

questions.text: What's the name of the pet dragon under the steps on TV's "The Munsters"?
questions.explanation:
Spot.

	The Munsters lived at 1313 Mockingbird Lane. Yvonne DeCarlo, who portrayed Lily Munster, had a supporting role in "The Ten Commandments" opposite Charlton Heston.

questions.text: What was John Lennon's middle name?
questions.explanation:
Winston.

	John Lennon was shot outside his apartment building, The Dakota, on December 8, 1980 by Mark David Chapman.

questions.text: In London, where are the Crown Jewels kept?
questions.explanation:
The Tower of London.

	Yeoman guards, commonly known as Beefeaters can still be found at the Tower of London. They give fascinating tours and can answer any question relevant to the Tower of London. The Crown Jewels are kept under glass and you see them as you are whisked along by conveyor belt. The movie before you go in to the see the jewels is quite informative.

questions.text: Geezer Butler was the bass player for what rock band?
questions.explanation:
Black Sabbath.

	Black Sabbath released their first album in 1970.  The original name for the band was Earth but they decided Black Sabbath was better suited for them.

questions.text: Who portrayed Charles Van Doren in the movie "Quiz Show"?
questions.explanation:
Ralph Fiennes.

	Ralph Fiennes also portrayed Amon Goethe in Schindler's List.

questions.text: In "Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs", which dwarf has the longest beard?
questions.explanation:
Sleepy.

	Sleepy has the longest beard, Happy has the biggest belly and Grumpy has the biggest nose.

questions.text: What was the name of the orange monster in the Bugs Bunny cartoon, "Water, Water Every Hare"?
questions.explanation:
Gossamer.

	The orange monster also co-starred in other similar cartoons as Rudy and Monster.  In my opinion, "Water, Water Every Hare" was the best of the three and it just happens to be my favorite!  "You monsters must lead interesting lives."
